lead_paragraph: You might expect that someone who spends his time watching, writing about, living and breathing theater 52 weeks a year would prefer to turn to other subjects when it comes to the pastime of leisure reading. Perhaps some molecular biology? And it's true that for sheer diversion, or post-season recovery, I do try to avoid books that feel like homework. My new discovery - and obsession - is the British writer Angela Thirkell, who wrote more than a dozen frothy light comedies about English country life, many set in Anthony Trollope's fictional Barsetshire.

headline.main: Theater Talkback: I Could Read a Book
